questions.question_text: When Splunk is integrated with LDAP, which attribute can be changed in the Splunk UI for an LDAP user?
Using the CLI on the forwarder, how could the current forwarder to indexer configuration be viewed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
Option C

Splunk system admin slides page 182 CLEARLY shows that to verify the configuration on the forwarder side by executing CLI command splunk list forward-server and on the indexer, side execute splunk display list
C is correct: splunk list forward-server

Selected Answer: B
B... A token is required.
The question probably refers to the HEC. A token is needed, so B is correct

questions.question_text: Which artifact is required in the request header when creating an HTTP event?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Search Time field extractions are stored on the search head

Selected Answer: D
The search head is responsible for managing search-time operations, including field extractions, which are defined in configuration files like props.conf and transforms.conf.

Selected Answer: D
Yes I would go with D
I would go for option D

Selected Answer: D
I was thinking D as well

questions.question_text: All search-time field extractions should be specified on which Splunk component?
In addition to single, non-clustered Splunk instances, what else can the deployment server push apps to?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

"The deployment server is the tool for distributing configurations, apps, and content updates to groups of Splunk Enterprise instances. You can use it to distribute updates to most types of Splunk Enterprise components: forwarders, non-clustered indexers, and search heads."
only A seems valid. Deployment server can't push apps to splunk cloud.
